item.title: error_game_js5connect_outofdate... Whats wrong?
item.dc:creator: @defyboy defyboy
item.description:
@defyboy wrote:

imafatmess:

Ok, I have been trying for about 5-6 hours of today to get the new deob to connect

Nope, Youve been trying for 5-6 hours trying to get an old deob to work.

var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503,
				"runescape", 420, InetAddress.getByName(host));

See the magic key 420 in there? the latest is 423.

Read full topic

item.title: error_game_js5connect_outofdate... Whats wrong?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Your problem is this

var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503, "runescape", [b]420[/b], InetAddress.getByName(host));

420 is an out of date version, thus “error_game_js5connect_outofdate”

Read full topic

item.title: error_game_js5connect_outofdate... Whats wrong?
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Ok, I have been trying for about 5-6 hours of today to get the new deob to connect but I always have the same trouble everytime, I get in command promt a message saying “error_game_js5connect_outofdate”. This always happens on the “connecting to update server” part of runescape loading and it terminates the program. I read somewhere on here that to get the new client to connect all you need to do is change

var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503, "runescape", 420, InetAddress.getLocalHost());

to

var_client.method22(Class58.anInt1372 + 32, 765, -29889, 12, 503, "runescape", 420, InetAddress.getByName(host));.

where host is a String decleration saying “at3.runescape.com” or some other one of jagex’s hosts. I did this and I also Have put the arguments for running this to be:

"35", "live", "live", "lowmem", "free", "english"

and have been running the client class from this:

public class Run { public static void main(String[] arg) { client.main(new String[]{"35", "live", "live", "lowmem", "free", "english"}); } }

I also have checked so many times that these arguments are correct and have found them to be.

Please can you help me with this as it is extremely aggrivating to have spent so long on this to no avail! I know it is probably something extremely easy to fix which I just overlooked but I really am getting pissed off now!

Thank you so much in advance!

Read full topic
